segments.content: This new version of Next.js introduces the new routing system and nested layouts in beta. The migration is incremental and optional: you will have to move your Next.js pages to a new `app/` folder. This enables the latest innovations, such as React Server Components and SSR streaming support on both Edge + Node.js runtimes.
segments.sourceMdx: This new version of Next.js introduces the new routing system and nested layouts in beta. The migration is incremental and optional: you will have to move your Next.js pages to a new `app/` folder. This enables the latest innovations, such as React Server Components and SSR streaming support on both Edge + Node.js runtimes.
segments.translated_content: 新版Next.js以beta形式引入了全新路由系统和嵌套布局。迁移过程采用渐进式可选方案：需将页面移至新的`app/`目录。此举支持React服务端组件等最新创新，并实现在Edge和Node.js运行时的SSR流式渲染。

segments.content: ⚡️ Other significant improvements:
segments.sourceMdx: ⚡️ Other significant improvements:
segments.translated_content: ⚡️ 其他重要改进：

segments.content:
* Turbopack: a new Rust bundler in alpha (details below).
* next/image: new lighter, flexible and faster image component, avoids shifting layouts
* @next/font: self-host fonts efficiently and avoid layout shifts (see also [Fontaine](https://twitter.com/danielcroe/status/1586472544491950080) presented last week)
segments.sourceMdx:

segments.translated_content: **[Turbopack发布：基于Rust的Webpack继任者](https://vercel.com/blog/turbopack)**

segments.content: Vercel has hired Tobias Koppers (creator of Webpack), to work on Turbopack, a new very fast bundler in Rust. For now, the tool is in alpha, supports mainly Next.js, and its features are limited. Support for other frameworks (Svelte, Vue...) and features (Tailwind...) will be added later.
segments.sourceMdx: Vercel has hired Tobias Koppers (creator of Webpack), to work on Turbopack, a new very fast bundler in Rust. For now, the tool is in alpha, supports mainly Next.js, and its features are limited. Support for other frameworks (Svelte, Vue...) and features (Tailwind...) will be added later.
segments.translated_content: Vercel聘请了Webpack创始人Tobias Koppers开发基于Rust的超快打包工具Turbopack。目前该工具处于Alpha阶段，主要支持Next.js，功能尚有限。未来将逐步添加对其他框架（Svelte、Vue等）和功能（Tailwind等）的支持。

segments.content: Turbopack is optimized for the developer experience, and Vercel announces that the tool is 700x faster than Webpack, and 20x faster than Vite. It is based on Turbo, a Rust memoization framework that is able to cache the result of each function independently. Vercel has also published an [article](https://turbo.build/blog/turbopack-benchmarks) with more detailed benchmarks.
segments.sourceMdx: Turbopack is optimized for the developer experience, and Vercel announces that the tool is 700x faster than Webpack, and 20x faster than Vite. It is based on Turbo, a Rust memoization framework that is able to cache the result of each function independently. Vercel has also published an [article](https://turbo.build/blog/turbopack-benchmarks) with more detailed benchmarks.
segments.translated_content: Turbopack针对开发者体验进行了优化，Vercel宣称其速度比Webpack快700倍，比Vite快20倍。该工具基于Turbo框架（一个能独立缓存每个函数结果的Rust记忆化框架）。Vercel还发布了包含[详细基准测试](https://turbo.build/blog/turbopack-benchmarks)的文章。

segments.content:
* [Jared Palmer](https://twitter.com/jaredpalmer/status/1584971637694222336) explains how caching works and that Turborepo/Turbopack could merge.
* [Evan You](https://twitter.com/youyuxi/status/1585040261922820096) question the benchmarks, and created a [Is Turbopack really 10x Faster than Vite?](https://github.com/yyx990803/vite-vs-next-turbo-hmr/discussions/8) page. Vite does not use SWC by default, and the published benchmarks rely on the use of Babel. Vite could replace esbuild/Rollup with Turbopack.
* [Sebastian McKenzie](https://twitter.com/sebmck/status/1584971938786861056) points out the relatively small performance gain on a cold start (x4), likely due to overhead in initializing the cache.
* [Devon Govett](https://twitter.com/devongovett/status/1585035737971724288) mentions that the architecture is similar to Parcel.
* [Amjad Masad](https://twitter.com/amasad/status/1585001646782033921) mentions that the React-Native Metro bundler has been using a similar caching system for a very long time.

segments.content: **[Remix Joins Shopify to Push the Web Forward](https://shopify.engineering/remix-joins-shopify)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Remix Joins Shopify to Push the Web Forward](https://shopify.engineering/remix-joins-shopify)**
segments.translated_content: **[Remix加入Shopify共同推动Web发展](https://shopify.engineering/remix-joins-shopify)**

segments.content: Remix has just joined Shopify, and will be used in their Hydrogen e-commerce meta-framework as well as other projects. Hydrogen 2.0 will replace the use of React Server Components with Remix APIs! They found the Remix model easier to understand and more powerful than Server Components.
segments.sourceMdx: Remix has just joined Shopify, and will be used in their Hydrogen e-commerce meta-framework as well as other projects. Hydrogen 2.0 will replace the use of React Server Components with Remix APIs! They found the Remix model easier to understand and more powerful than Server Components.
segments.translated_content: Remix被Shopify收购后，将用于其Hydrogen电商元框架等项目。Hydrogen 2.0将用Remix API替代React服务端组件！Shopify认为Remix模型比服务端组件更易理解且功能更强大。

segments.content: To me, this is a great acquisition. Shopify can focus on Hydrogen's value proposition rather than infrastructure concerns, and benefits from Remix's progressive enhancement, especially important for e-commerce. Not to mention that Remix is decoupled from React, and Shopify is working on a [Hydrogen UI](https://github.com/Shopify/hydrogen-ui) agnostic library: Shopify should be able to reach developers from various frameworks (Vue, Svelte...), without having to impose React, while relying on a shared infrastructure.
segments.sourceMdx: To me, this is a great acquisition. Shopify can focus on Hydrogen's value proposition rather than infrastructure concerns, and benefits from Remix's progressive enhancement, especially important for e-commerce. Not to mention that Remix is decoupled from React, and Shopify is working on a [Hydrogen UI](https://github.com/Shopify/hydrogen-ui) agnostic library: Shopify should be able to reach developers from various frameworks (Vue, Svelte...), without having to impose React, while relying on a shared infrastructure.
segments.translated_content: 此次收购意义重大：Shopify可专注于Hydrogen的核心价值主张而非基础设施，并受益于Remix的渐进增强特性（对电商至关重要）。值得注意的是，Remix与React解耦，Shopify正在开发框架无关的[Hydrogen UI](https://github.com/Shopify/hydrogen-ui)库——既能覆盖Vue/Svelte等框架开发者，又无需强推React技术栈。

* [Ryan Florence](https://twitter.com/ryanflorence/status/1587171069915385856) mentions that Shopify is not against Server Components, and that they will probably be re-introduced in Remix later.
* [Ryan Florence](https://twitter.com/ryanflorence/status/1587090973594558464) explains how this acquisition will allow them to fully focus on Remix.

segments.content:
* 🤔 [React core - Add fetch Instrumentation to Dedupe Fetches](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/25516): monkey-patching `fetch` is [controversial](https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/25573).
* 💬 [RFC - TypeScript + React - Allow anything to be rendered by function components](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/62876)
* 📜 [Full Stack Components](https://www.epicweb.dev/full-stack-components): Kent C. Dodds explains that Remix allows to create truly full-stack components, which encapsulate frontend and backend code in the same file. Remix's full-stack patterns are not limited to routing but can also be used on micro-interactions via the `useFetcher` hook: like button, autocomplete...
* 📜 [Optimization techniques for Rive animations in React apps](https://pixelpoint.io/blog/rive-react-optimizations/): Rive is a more efficient animation library than Lottie. Alex explains how to optimize the loading of Rive animations in a Gatsby or Next.js app: self-hosting of the WASM runtime, Webpack loader, preloading, lazy-loading... Good techniques to know that can be used in other contexts.
* 📜 [Deploy Next.js 13 on Netlify Today](https://www.netlify.com/blog/deploy-nextjs-13/): Netlify brings support for the latest Next.js 13 innovations.
* 📜 [Code coverage with Storybook test runner](https://storybook.js.org/blog/code-coverage-with-the-storybook-test-runner/): summarizes well the test features of Storybook. It is now possible to generate a coverage report thanks to the [Istanbul](https://istanbul.js.org/) instrumentation. The reporting format is configurable.
* 📜 [The Gatsby Slice API: High Precision Incremental Builds](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/gatsby-slice-api/): explains how the new Gatsby 5 API works to improve build performance when a layout component (header, footer) is updated.
* 📜 [Seeding the Query Cache](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/seeding-the-query-cache): describes a possible waterfall problem with React-Query when using Suspense. Suggests using `prefetchQuery` before component mount to optimize loading as much as possible. Gives an idea of how React-Query intends to integrate with the latest React innovations.
* 📜 [How to Build a Blog with Fresh](https://deno.com/blog/build-a-blog-with-fresh): Fresh is the Preact framework based on Deno
* 📦 [Gatsby 5](https://twitter.com/GatsbyJS/status/1587136776828772353): the new version should be released today! The [Gatsby Valhalla Content Hub](https://twitter.com/GatsbyJS/status/1587489648397410320) should make it possible to use the GraphQL data-layer of Gatsby in other frameworks!
* 📦 [Docusaurus 2.2](https://twitter.com/docusaurus/status/1586347397667495936): support of Mermaid diagrams
* 📦 [Asta](https://github.com/yisar/asta): new resumable SSR framework, inspired by Qwik and Marko, with a React-like syntax. To be continued!
* 📦 [TanStack Query 4.14](https://twitter.com/TkDodo/status/1587411685517697028): new ESLint plugin
* 📦 [Remix Forms 1.0](https://twitter.com/danielweinmann/status/1587465389990084609)
* 📦 [Downshift 7.0](https://github.com/downshift-js/downshift/releases/tag/v7.0.0)

- 📜 [React 应用中 Rive 动画的优化技巧](https://pixelpoint.io/blog/rive-react-optimizations/)：Rive 是比 Lottie 更高效的动画库。Alex 详细介绍了在 Gatsby 或 Next.js 应用中优化 Rive 动画加载的方法：自托管 WASM 运行时、Webpack 加载器、预加载、懒加载... 这些通用技巧也适用于其他场景。
- 📜 [立即在 Netlify 上部署 Next.js 13](https://www.netlify.com/blog/deploy-nextjs-13/)：Netlify 现已支持 Next.js 13 的最新特性。
- 📜 [使用 Storybook 测试运行器实现代码覆盖率](https://storybook.js.org/blog/code-coverage-with-the-storybook-test-runner/)：全面总结了 Storybook 的测试功能。现在通过 [Istanbul](https://istanbul.js.org/) 工具可以生成覆盖率报告，且报告格式可配置。
- 📜 [Gatsby Slice API：高精度增量构建](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/gatsby-slice-api/)：解析 Gatsby 5 新 API 如何优化布局组件（如页眉、页脚）更新时的构建性能。
- 📜 [预填充查询缓存](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/seeding-the-query-cache)：分析了 React-Query 结合 Suspense 使用时可能出现的瀑布流问题。建议在组件挂载前使用 `prefetchQuery` 最大化加载优化，并展望了 React-Query 与最新 React 特性的整合方向。
- 📜 [使用 Fresh 构建博客](https://deno.com/blog/build-a-blog-with-fresh)：Fresh 是基于 Deno 的 Preact 框架

segments.sourceMdx: The new Expo SDK is available in beta for one week. Some headlines:
segments.translated_content: 新版Expo SDK将进行为期一周的beta测试，主要更新包括：

segments.content:
* Upgrades to React-Native 0.70.4 and React 18.1
* Hermes available in Expo Go on iOS. Hermes will be the default JS engine from SDK 48.
* Fabric support in many Expo modules
* Expo Modules API 1.0 that makes it easy to create native Fabric modules in Swift/Kotlin
* Filesystem routing for React-Navigation in beta. The last release [v0.0.34](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1587303631602307076) is compatible with SDK 47.
